q.l: Me mare, me venti, me fera iactat hyems.

div.l: Were sweet Comedian Scoenes of loue
And forc'd to sing sad Obsequies
Three times foure houres in twenty foure,
On me poore wretch to blow.
Ore-seel'd with thundring claps of clouds,
I, I, it is my fate,
The time of my times losse.
To be a mirrour of mis-haps,
A Cypher twixt the Greekes and Turkes
But all my sutes are vaine,
And makes me say, My worlds eye-sight
Is bought at too high rate.
Would God I might but liue
Where Orchards, Castles, Townes, and Woods,
